SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Class DatabaseSaveBuilder<T>

java.lang.Object
org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseSaveBuilder<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DatabaseSaveBuilderWithLong, DatabaseSaveBuilderWithoutGeneratedKeys, DatabaseSaveBuilderWithUUID
@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault public abstract class DatabaseSaveBuilder<T> extends Object
Generate INSERT or UPDATE statements on a DatabaseTable by collecting field names and parameters. Support autogeneration of primary keys and unique natural keys. Example: 
 DatabaseSaveResult<Long> result = table.newSaveBuilder("id", object.getId())
      .uniqueKey("name", object.getName())
      .setField("value", object.getValue())
      .execute(connection);
 object.setId(result.getId());

  • Method Details

    • uniqueKey

      @CheckReturnValue public DatabaseSaveBuilder<T> uniqueKey(String fieldName, @Nullable Object fieldValue)
      Specify a natural key for this table. If the id is null and there is a unique key match, UPDATE is called with this row and the existing primary key is returned, instead of INSERT. If more than one uniqueKey, fluent-jdbc assumes a composite unique constraint, that is all fields must match

    • setField

      @CheckReturnValue public DatabaseSaveBuilder<T> setField(String fieldName, @Nullable Object fieldValue)
      Specify a column name to be saved

    • execute

      @Nonnull public DatabaseSaveResult<T> execute(@Nonnull Connection connection)
      Executes the UPDATE or INSERT statement and returns a DatabaseSaveResult which explains what operation was executed.
      • If id was set and tableWhereId(Object) returns no object, inserts a new row.
      • If id was set and tableWhereId(Object) returns a row, updates this row if differingFields(DatabaseRow, Connection) is non empty or treats the row as unchanged otherwise
      • If id was null and tableWhereUniqueKey() returns no object, inserts a new row, generating a new primary key
      • If id was null and tableWhereUniqueKey() returns a row, updates this row if differingFields(DatabaseRow, Connection) is non empty or treats the row as unchanged otherwise

    • tableWhereId

      @CheckReturnValue protected DatabaseTableQueryBuilder tableWhereId(@Nullable T p)
      Creates a query where primary key is specified

    • tableWhereUniqueKey

      @CheckReturnValue protected DatabaseTableQueryBuilder tableWhereUniqueKey()
      Creates a query where all unique fields are specified

    • differingFields

      @CheckReturnValue protected List<String> differingFields(DatabaseRow row, Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Compares the values on the DatabaseRow with the fields specified in this object and returns the columns in the database with a different value
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • hasUniqueKey

      @CheckReturnValue protected boolean hasUniqueKey()
      Returns true if at least one field was specified as uniqueKey(String, Object) and all uniqueKeyValues are non-null

    • insert

      @Nullable protected abstract T insert(@Nonnull Connection connection)
      Build and execute the INSERT-statement to insert this row
